section.name: PBIndex Task Manual
section.p: PBIndex is an Ant task to maintain a ProjectBuilder PB.project file. This file is needed even when ProjectBuilder is not used, since other WebObjects tools, like WebObjectsBuilder, use it to obtain the information about the project.

PBIndex should be run after adding or removing classes, WOComponents and resources to/from the project to make WOBuilder aware of such changes. Another possible use of PBIndex is to avoid PB.project merge problems when changes are done to the project simultaneously by multiple developers. It should also be helpful when developing in an environment where ProjectBuilder is used together with other IDE's.

tr.td: Name of the framework or application project.
PB.project file location. When ommitted, PB.project file in the current directory is assumed. If the file at the specified location does not exist, it is created using internal template.
Boolean value that defines whether the target project is an application or a framework. Default is false (application).

section.p: The nested src element specifies a FileSet matching Java source files used in the project. Note that only *.java files will be included out of all the files matched.
The nested resources element specifies a FileSet matching a set of project resources, such as .api files. (Note: do not include WOComponents in this list.)
The nested wsresources element specifies a FileSet matching all web server resources used in the project, such as images, CSS, etc.
The nested wocomponents element specifies a FileSet matching all WOComponents used in the project. Note that only *.wo directories will be included out of all the files and directories matched.
